title: proxima
content: Proxima is a simulation world that aims to study non-player characters' interactions. It consists a total of 4,294,967,296 unique NPCs; the number of NPCs in Proxima remains the same. However, these NPCs occasionally get their event-log saved, reset, and re-deployed. Data generated by an NPC during its lifespan is called the 'event-log.'

title: heptaheads
content: HeptaHeads are unique NPCs of the simulation world 'Proxima', every Heptahead is assigned with key attributes like unique ID, name, unique pixelated avatar, gender, and role in the simulation. Besides their avatar, Heptaheads do not have any other graphical feature. NPCs interact with each other within a region called an organisation to generate event logs. After the lifespan (deployment period), HeptaHeads are reset and redeployed with blank event logs. A replacement is made when the logs don't get adequately reset, which is an infrequent and unexplained event. Records of every replaced HeptaHead will be maintained and published on the Proxima Weblog.

title: time
content: This log explains how time works in 'Proxima' relative to the real world. Time is measured in terms of 'clicks', and the clicks have a frequency of 24kHz; thus, time passes ~24000x faster than the real world. One Proxima-day is 3.6 seconds long, which is divided into three equal parts morning, evening and night. The number of NPC interactions varies at different times of the day, e.g., more interactions during morning and evening than night. The lifespan of a HeptaHead is 66 Proxima-years, approximately equivalent to 1 Day, i.e. every HeptaHead in the simulation gets reset and redeployed in a span of 24 hours.

title: feedback
content: The two status bars 'Proxi' and 'Bliss' are used as feedback trackers for the NPCs, both of which must be maintained in a specific ratio called 'Stasis'. Every Heptahead is assigned with a different range for 'Stasis', which they have to retain while maximising the amount of 'Proxi' and 'Bliss'. Heptaheads earn 'Proxi' by completing daily tasks within the assigned organisation, whereas 'Bliss' can be traded for 'Proxi' by interacting with other NPCs. This trade for Proxi/Bliss balances the 'Stasis' and encourages interactions among the NPCs. However, there is a chance that the exchange may fail, and one of the parties encounter a loss. The success or failure depends on the traits of NPCs and the current state of their status bar. The chances of failure are slim, but it keeps a check on redundant interactions.
